boat.full_description:
'Tarka' has been a well-known boat on the East Coast, regularly taking part in OGA events.

She was described by her owner, Tony Bailey, in 1990 as, 'A solid yet perky boat, in fine shape, great fun to sail and ideal for coastal cruising and gaffer racing.'

Advertised for sale in the OGA Newsletter, 1983, 'Tarka' is described as follows:

3.25 ton cutter, 22' x 19' x 7' x 3.5'. Two berths. Stuart 8, new main and topsil (Lawrence), 1982. Three headsails, new bunk cushions, good cruising inventory inc. mini seacourse, midas log, sestral compass, seafarer echo sounder, masthead tricolour, VHF aerial, 12 volt batttery (1980). Flush WC. Whale 8 gusher. Flexible water tank, 8 galls. 2 burner and grill calor stove. Major refit carried out during winter 1981/2, when all internal furniture and stowage was rebuilt and all woodwork burnt off ane repainted. Extensive single handed cruising East Coast and near continent over last 12 years and a regular entrant in EC Race, twice winning the Stone Trophy. Selling to obtain a larger boat £3,500.
